clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Sitravatinib With or Without Other Anticancer Therapies Receiving Clinical Benefit From Parent Study
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Open-label Rollover Study of Sitravatinib Alone or in Combination With Other Anticancer Therapies in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Solid Malignancies

brief_summary.textblock: A Study of Sitravatinib Alone or in Combination with Other Anticancer Therapies in Advanced or Metastatic Malignancies

detailed_description.textblock:
Sitravatinib is a spectrum-selective receptor tyrosine kinase (RTK) inhibitor that inhibits several closely related RTKs including the TAM family (Tyro3/Axl/MERTK), VEGFR2, KIT, and MET.
The current study is designed to allow continued access to sitravatinib and to evaluate the safety and tolerability of sitravatinib alone or in combination with other anticancer therapies in patients who are deriving clinical benefit in a previous parent clinical trial.

primary_outcome.measure: Frequency of subjects experiencing treatment-related AEs.
primary_outcome.description: Frequency of subjects experiencing treatment-related AEs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to clinical or radiographic progression on study.
secondary_outcome.description: Time to clinical or radiographic progression on study.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Phase 2/3: Open label extension of parent study
arm_group.description: The current study is designed to allow continued access to sitravatinib and to evaluate the safety and tolerability of sitravatinib alone or in combination with other anticancer therapies in patients who are deriving clinical benefit in a previous parent clinical trial.

intervention.description: Sitravatinib is a small molecule inhibitor of recepor tyrosine kinases.
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 2/3: Open label extension of parent study

intervention.description: Nivolumab is a programmed death receptor-1 (PD-1) blocking antibody
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 2/3: Open label extension of parent study

intervention.description: Pembrolizumab is a programmed death receptor-1 (PD-1) blocking antibody
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 2/3: Open label extension of parent study

intervention.description: Enfortumab is a Nectin-4 directed antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) comprised of a monoclonal antibody conjugated to the small molecule microtubule disrupting agent, monomethyl auristatin E (MMAE)
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 2/3: Open label extension of parent study

intervention.description: Ipilimumab is a CTLA-4 (cytotoxic T-lymphocyte-associated protein 4) blocking antibody
intervention.arm_group_label: Phase 2/3: Open label extension of parent study

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Currently receiving sitravatinib single- agent or in combination with other therapeutic agent(s) in another Mirati- sponsored protocol
- Currently tolerating the treatment regimen in the parent protocol
- Experiencing clinical benefit with or without prior radiographic progression from the treatment regimen in the parent protocol in the opinion of the investigator and the investigator determines that continuing treatment is in the patient's best interest
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known or suspected presence of other cancer
- Other life- threatening illness or organ system dysfunction compromising safety evaluation

facility.name: University of Minnesota Health Clinics and Surgery Center
The Ohio State University Wexner Medical Center - Thoracic Oncology Clinic
